content: गर्भः [गॄ-भन् <ls>Uṇ. 3. 152</ls>] {@--1@} The womb, the belly; गर्भेषु वसतिः <ls>Pt. 1</ls>; पुनर्गर्भे च संभवं <ls>Ms. 6. 63.</ls> {@--2@} A fœtus, embryo; act of conception, pregnancy; conception; नरपतिकुलभूत्यै गर्भमाधत्त राज्ञी <ls>R. 2. 75</ls>; गर्भोऽभवद्भूधरराजपत्न्याः <ls>Ku. 1. 19</ls>; गर्भं वहति <ls>Pt. 1. 30</ls> bears a child in the womb. {@--3@} The time of conception; गर्भाष्टमेऽब्दे कुर्वीत ब्राह्मणस्योपनायनं <ls>Ms. 2. 36.</ls> {@--4@} The child (in the womb); <ls>Ś. 6.</ls> {@--5@} A child, brood or offspring of birds. {@--6@} The inside, middle, or interior of anything (in <ab>comp.</ab> in this sense and translated by ‘full of,’ ‘filled with,’ ‘containing’ &c.); हिमगर्भैर्मयूखैः <ls>Ś. 3. 3</ls>; शुक° कोटर <ls n="Ś.">1. 14</ls>; <ls n="Ś.">7. 7</ls>; °पत्रं <ls>U. 3. 5.</ls> inwardly situated; अग्निगर्भां शमीमिव <ls>Ś. 4. 1</ls>; <ls>R. 3. 9</ls>, <ls n="R.">5. 17</ls>, <ls n="R.">9. 55</ls>; <ls>Śi. 9. 62</ls>; <ls>Māl. 3. 12</ls>; <ls>Mu. 1. 12.</ls> {@--7@} The offspring of the sky, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} the vapours and fogs drawn upwards by the rays of the sun during {8} months and sent down again in the rainy season; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ms. 9. 305.</ls> {@--8@} An inner apartment, a lying-in-chamber. {@--9@} Any interior chamber. {@--10@} A hole. {@--11@} Fire. {@--12@} Food. {@--13@} The rough coat of the jack-fruit (पनसकंटक). {@--14@} The bed of a river, especially of the Ganges on the fourteenth day of the dark half of Bhādrapada or in the very height of the rains when the river is fullest. {@--15@} The fruit (of plants). {@--16@} Joining, union. {@--17@} The calyx of a lotus. {@--18@} (In dramas) One of the {%Saṃdhis%} <ab>q. v.</ab>
